title: I geniunely wish that the new void champion wasn't a human. We need more monsters.
body: She also look too much like Irelia and Vayne.

replies.body: At least she's not a millennia old entity inside the body of a teenage girl
*preteen.

I gotta be honest, if this leak is real (looks likely it is) I will be pretty disappointed. Doubly so if it's Kassadin's daughter. The design seems really safe and uninspired, like I've seen this Champion already in the game before. 

I don't even mind that she looks humanoid, what bothers me more is that they could have made her super creepy and uncanny, really emphasizing the fact that the Void is a scary place that breaks people. I'm talking something inspired by the girl from the Ring or something, human-looking, was probably once human, but is twisted into something horrifying and has become just a host for something unthinkable. Riot could have flexed their horror muscles even a little, but instead we are getting chick wearing Void suit that harnesses the Void? Is there going to be some kind of struggle against corruption? I just don't see an interesting angle with this design, she seems more like a poor interpretation of Kassadin sprinkled with a smidge of Kayn edge and turned into a woman. 

Maybe her lore/voice will change my mind, I don't know though. Feels like a wasted opportunity for sure.
kassadin and malzahar are already that, so it would be redundant

Already what? Creepy? I disagree. 

Malzahar and Kassadin are pretty normal. Yeah, Malz has a third eye and is all glow-y, Kassadin is restricted to his suit, but overall they function and behave like relatively normal human beings (emphasis on relatively). 

What I'm talking about is something that encroaches the uncanny valley. It walks _sorta_ like a human, it speaks _kinda_ like a human, but then again, it's head turns 180 degrees and it's face has this unidentifiable rotting flesh wound....

You know, something like that. Something that makes your skin crawl a little. Like seeing a corpse and thinking "this _used_ to be human...but it isn't anymore".

prerework urgot was that and no one touched him with a ten pole stick. Horror champs like vel coz, rek sai, kalista, yorick (look at his ghouls) are definitely a niche Riot explores. However they HAVE to be aesthetic in some way, if they just look like a pile of crap with legs no one will play them

Edit: also if you look at her ability icons her face does transform into a 3 eye weird thing, my guess is when she uses ult/ goes invis

Pre rework Urgot had plenty of gameplay problems that deterred people. His model was extremely outdated, too. He was also one of those Champions who had dedicated mains who loved the "ugliness" of him. They kept a lot of elements of his old design even. I would also argue that Urgot was less "creepy" and more "grotesque" although obviously those have overlap.

Heck, if anything they up'ed the horror elements of him. His ult is one of the scariest things in the game; the idea of being ground up into pulp is already scary, but the sounds, visuals and general execution make it terrifying. 

I'm not saying they can't be aesthetically pleasing, but there's big-boobed pretty-faced girl, there's ugly terrifying abomination of man, and there is a HUUUUUUUGE range in between. I just felt like this design is a little too close to the former, when I would prefer it to be towards the latter.

For all the hype I had, this is a little...disappointing. I was totally expecting a Void-corrupted human, but her current appearance seems so conservative. The designers could've really made a creepy looking human to really show off the corruption of the Void. 
Some hybrid human-insectoid ala Sarah Kerrigan:

Humans sell much better than monsters. Very few ppl actually like monster champions. I remember Riot saying something like that in one of their year end things.

I can see where some of you are coming from in regards to how she looks but as SwineTV mentioned,  monster champs apparently don't do very well popularity wise. So personally, I think if they made her stark raving mad that be awesome. In the little blurb on her reveal page it says that she "endured through sheer will and a symbiotic second skin adapted from a living Void creature" which at first seemed pretty lame because (it sounds like) they're setting her up to be some kind of Bear Grylls ultimate survivor. 

BUT I was thinking of it form a logical prospective. If I was lost in the Void I wouldn't think "You know what I should definitely do right now? Take off my cloths and slip into the hide/skin of an animal I found." That makes no sense. How would that help with survival? I can under stand cutting open a tauntaun to stay warm or wearing a lion's skin because you're proud of that kill, but what person in their right mind would pick up the second skin of some eldritch creature and just wear it?

No one. No on in there right mind would do that. Which is why (I think) it would be awesome if she's completely lost it. She's been wandering around in the Void terrified and alone for along enough that when she stumbles upon/takes this symbiotic skin from she's just giggling and crying to herself going "Ya this'll fix things. This'll well help." and shoves her self into it because why not? Up is down at this point. 

Personally I think that makes for a better story.

"Monsters have a tough life as it is, being monsters and all, but it also seems like players don’t pick them as much as humanoids. One theory for their unpopularity is that maybe it’s just easier to identify with—or aspire to be—a badass demon hunter over a lonely crystal scorpion."
